medium: Raku ware, stoneware with glaze and enamels, wood handle, leather
text: A melon-shaped ochre-colored vessel with a wooden bail handle connected to the body with butterflies, and a top decorated with three white peonies surrounded by blue and green gradated leaves. The top is reticulated, separating the space between the flowers, leaves, and branches, and a large oval mouth at the front is encircled in blue. The handle is covered with a piece of brown leather the same color as the wood.
title: Tebachi in the shape of a gourd
